details.feedback: Operator accurately took the order and verified drink choice but made no suggestive-selling attempts. Two valid upsizing chances (large fries and large Diet Coke) were missed and no large-size wording was offered, so Scenario VO-01/VO-02/VO-04 were not utilized. Operator also missed an additional-topping chance on the Blizzard (extra caramel cookie pieces). No upselling chances were present, so none were required. Future improvement: after confirming the meal, offer to make the fries and drink large and suggest extra mix-ins for the Blizzard to increase check average while staying helpful.

transcript:
Operator: The wonderful day at Dairy Queen, how can we make it yours?
Customer: Hi, can I get a single burger meal please?
Operator: Cheeseburger, okay. What would the drink be?
Customer: Can I have a Diet Coke please?
Operator: Yes you can, anything else?
Customer: Could I also get a small caramel coffee cookie with it?
Operator: Yes you can, anything else?
Customer: That'll be all.
Operator: Alright, so it's going to be $10.81. Would you like to round up to note in the pocket?
Customer: Sure.
Operator: Thank you, we appreciate it. It's going to be $11 even.
Customer: Thank you.
Operator: You're welcome.

details.feedback: Operator offered extra peanut butter cups for the blizzard which was a correct additional topping attempt, but missed two upselling chances to suggest the 2 for 5 deal connected to each small sundae and made no upsizing offers. Also did not suggest whipped cream, nuts or sprinkles for the sundaes. Overall, needs to improve awareness of 2for5 promo and topping opportunities while maintaining current strength in polite service.

Operator: Thank you, we appreciate it, it's going to be $10 even.

details.feedback: Agent efficiently confirmed order and charity round-up but missed all revenue-generating opportunities. Two separate Dilly Bars each carried a VO-11 upsizing chance to offer a cost-effective box of six, yet no large-size or box suggestion was presented. Frozen Hot Chocolate had an add-on possibility (extra malt or topping) but no attempt was made. Suggest training on treat-category upsizing language such as 'Would you like to take advantage of our 6-pack Dilly Bar value box?' and prompting for premium mix-ins on specialty beverages. Remember: always ask for the large or value pack when a size is not maximized and suggest appropriate add-ons.

No relevant upselling scenarios applied as none of the ordered items match burger/combo or 2for5 drink categories. details.feedback: The agent accurately confirmed the two small vanilla treats but did not attempt any suggestive selling. A valid 2-for-$5 upsell existed for the small sundae and no offer was made. Both treats allow paid add-ons such as sprinkles or whipped cream, yet none were offered. Because sizes were specified, no legitimate upsize chances existed, but the agent still could have driven check growth through toppings and the value promo. Recommend training on recognising menu based promos and consistently presenting them with the correct wording before closing the order.
details.issues: Upselling reference: Scenario NO-01 and VO-01 (2for5) in Upselling Scenarios table, Small Sundae item in menu JSON (upselling chance 2for5). Additional topping reference: Sundae and Cone rows in menu JSON (Sprinkles, Whipped Cream, Nuts). No upsizing: size specified so Scenario Null-02. Ambiguity: Classifying “small vanilla ice cream in a cup” as a Small Sundae; assumed since cup equals sundae per menu, and no alternate plain cup item listed. All counts derived accordingly.

Operator: It's a wonderful day at Dairy Queen, how can we make it yours?
Customer: Hi, um, let's see, may I have a double combo with a large diet coke?
Operator: You want a double cheeseburger with a large diet coke?
Customer: A number, I guess a number five. A double, yeah, I guess a double cheeseburger.
Operator: Okay, would you like both the fries to be a large as well?
Customer: Uh, yes please.
Operator: Okay, anything else?
Customer: Can you throw in some ketchup as well?
Operator: Yes I can.
Customer: Thank you.
Operator: No problem. Alright, that total for you is going to be $13.17.
Customer: Thank you.
Operator: You're welcome.

They also attempted an additional-topping upsell by suggesting extra peanut butter cups. Both offers followed approved phrasing. Customer declined both, so no conversions were logged. No burger, hot dog, or basket items were present, so there were no combo or drink-add opportunities. Interaction was concise and compliant with suggestive-selling guidelines.

transcript:
Operator: It's a wonderful day at Dairy Queen, how can we make it yours?
Customer: Yes ma'am, let me get a Reese's Blizzard.
Operator: Okay, would that be a large Blizzard?
Customer: Um, no, I don't need a large one, just whatever size below that.
Operator: A medium?
Customer: A regular size, medium, small, yeah. Just a Reese's cup Blizzard, yep.
Operator: Okay, would you like extra peanut butter cups?
Customer: I'm sorry?
Operator: Would you like extra peanut butter cups?
Customer: No, just whatever cup is fine.
Operator: Alright, this total is going to be $6.45.
Customer: Thank you.
Operator: You're welcome.

Operator: It's a great day at Dairy Queen, how can I get for you?
Customer: Do you guys have the cheesecake Blizzard, the Royal New York cheesecake?
Operator: Yes.
Customer: Can I just do a small?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: And then can I also get some fries?
Operator: Is that going to be a large fry?
Customer: Uh, yeah, that's fine.
Operator: Alright, what else?
Customer: And then that's for the first order. For the second order, um, can I get an original cheeseburger and a small mint Oreo Blizzard?
Operator: Sure thing. Anything else for you?
Customer: That's all.
Operator: Alright, pull forward.
Customer: Alright.

details.feedback: Operator confirmed the order clearly but made no suggestive selling attempts. There was one valid upselling opportunity on the large sweet tea to promote the 2-for-$5 deal (offer a small sundae, pretzel, chilli dog or another drink) that was missed. All item sizes were specified, so no legitimate upsizing chances existed, and the clarifying question "large or small?" on the Blizzard did not count as a valid upsizing offer. Two Blizzard add-on topping opportunities were also ignored. Strength: accurate order recap and polite service. Improvement: actively use the scripted upsell prompts and offer extra Blizzard toppings to increase average check.

Difficulties: Transcript mentions a "mini" Blizzard size not in JSON; treated as size-specified, thus no upsize chance. Clarifying question from operator resembled size query but counted as invalid offer per Note about asking sizes, therefore not tallied.

transcript:
Operator: Clear at DQ, can I get for you?
Customer: Hi, can I get the caramel toffee cookie please?
Operator: The caramel toffee? Is that going to be a large?
Customer: Yes, please.
Operator: Okay, a large caramel toffee. What else can I get for you?
Customer: That's it.
Operator: Okay, it's going to be $7.24. You want to round up for note in the pocket today?
Customer: Yes, please.
Operator: Alright, we appreciate that. It'll be $8 even.
Customer: Thank you.

details.feedback: Operator captured the order accurately and confirmed condiments but offered no suggestive selling. With a burger and drink there was one valid upsell chance to add fries or convert to a combo (Scenario VO-06 / NO-04) yet no offer was made. No upsizing attempt was made for the drink since size was specified. Charity round-up request does not count as upsell. All sales opportunities were missed; operator should apply required scripts to boost average check.

transcript:
Operator: It's a great day, Derek. What can I get for you?
Customer: Yeah, I'd like a double cheeseburger.
Operator: Sure thing. Is ketchup, mustard, pickles okay on it?
Customer: Just a double cheeseburger. Ketchup, mustard, and pickles, yeah. And then the medium coke.
Operator: Sure thing. Anything else for you?
Customer: That'll do it.
Operator: Okay, total's going to come out to $9.07. You want to round up to even $10 for note in the pocket today?
Customer: Excuse me?
Operator: I'm sorry?
Customer: What's that?
Operator: Did you want to round up to even $10 for note in the pocket?
Customer: No.
Operator: Alright, go ahead and pull forward.

details.feedback: The operator was friendly but missed sales opportunities. A medium drink triggered a VO-01 2for5 upsell chance, yet no offer to add a sundae, pretzel or chili dog was made. All items already had stated sizes, so no legitimate upsizing chances existed, but the agent still asked for Blizzard size, an unnecessary clarifying question that did not constitute an upsizing attempt. The Blizzard and dipped cone each carried additional-topping possibilities (extra mix-ins or double dip), but no suggestive add-on was offered. Advise reviewing VO-01 script and additional-topping prompts to improve revenue and guest experience.

transcript:
Operator: Clear your day, is there anything I can get for you?
Customer: Just a second.
Operator: Sure, let me know when you're ready.
Customer: Alright, could I have a small New York cheesecake blizzard with extra cheesecake, a regular fry, and a medium Coke?
Operator: What size is that New York cheesecake?
Customer: Small.
Operator: Alright, will that be everything for you?
Customer: And a kid's chocolate dip cone.
Operator: Okay.
Customer: That's it.
Operator: Alright, it's going to be $15.01. You want to round up to even $16 for note in the pocket?
Customer: No, thank you.
Operator: Alright, we're in full form.

Operator: Clear your day, is there anything I can get for you?
Customer: He's thinking, hang on.

details.feedback: The operator correctly offered to upsize the three unspecified Cokes to large size using compliant phrasing, generating three valid upsize offers. The customer declined, so no conversions occurred. For both shakes the operator only asked what size was wanted instead of specifically suggesting the large, so these were missed upsize opportunities. No upsell opportunities applied to this order. The operator also missed two valid add-on chances by not offering extra malt or mix-ins for the shakes. Strength: clear, succinct upsize offer for the drinks. Improvement: always recommend the large size when a customer does not specify on shakes and other size-based items, and proactively suggest extra mix-ins or malt to boost check average.

Upsizing scenario reference: Scenario VO-02 Drink for valid phrasing. Additional topping reference: Shakes & Malts add-on Extra Malt or primary topping. Ambiguities: Shakes are not named in upsizing scenario list, but menu JSON confirms size variants, so counted as upsize chances. Operator query about whipped cream treated as confirmation of default ingredient, not an add-on offer. No upselling chances per definitions for drinks or shakes.

transcript:
Operator: Clear your day, is there anything I can get for you?
Customer: Can I get three cokes?
Operator: Are those going to be large?
Customer: Medium.
Operator: Alright, three medium cokes, what else can I get for you?
Customer: Yes.
Operator: Anything else?
Customer: Give me one maple cookie shake.
Operator: Okay, what size do you want?
Customer: Small.
Operator: Okay, you want to keep the whipped cream?
Customer: Anything else for you?
Customer: And can we also get one Oreo milkshake?
Operator: What size?
Customer: Medium.
Operator: Alright, you want the whipped cream on it?
Customer: I'm sorry?
Operator: You want the whipped cream on it?
Customer: Yes, please.
Operator: Alright, what else can I get for you?
Customer: Alright, thank you.
Operator: Alright, full form.

details.feedback: Good job suggesting a drink with the 6-piece Honey BBQ Chicken Basket and capturing the sale; however, you missed several other revenue opportunities: you could have offered an extra dipping sauce, promoted the 2-for-$5 add-on when the guest ordered a small sundae, suggested making the basket fries large, or upsizing either dessert. You also skipped topping suggestions for the sundae and Blizzard. Remember to ask explicitly about large sizes and to run through all appropriate offers to maximize check.

Upselling scenarios VO-07 (drink for basket) used correctly; additional missed chances from same scenario and VO-01 (2for5). Upsizing scenarios VO-04 (side large) applicable but not used. No contradictory instructions; main ambiguity was whether basket counted as meal, resolved using Item table indicating basket includes fries but not drink.

transcript:
Operator: What can I get for you?
Customer: Sorry, what?
Operator: Go ahead with your order.
Customer: Can I get a six-piece sauce and toss honey barbecue with ranch?
Operator: Did you want a drink with it?
Customer: I did chicken strips and the Dr. Pepper.
Operator: We have Mr. Pibb, is that okay?
Customer: Yes.
Operator: All right, what else can I get for you?
Customer: Can we get a small fudge sundae?
Operator: Is that hot fudge?
Customer: Hot.
Operator: Sure thing. What else can I get for you?
Customer: And then, is your caramel toffee cookie blizzard good?
Operator: I haven't tried it, but it's been very popular today.
Customer: Okay, can I have a small one of those?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: That's it.
Operator: All right, and then I'll have the sundae that was small as well.
Customer: Yes, thank you.
Operator: No problem. Your total is going to come out to $10.

details.feedback: The operator recorded the guest’s order correctly but missed all suggestive-selling opportunities. Scenario VO-07 allows an upsell offer of dipping sauce whenever fries are purchased, yet no offer was made. Every item had a stated size so no valid upsizing chances existed, but the shake and sundae each permit paid add-ons (extra malt, nuts, whipped cream, sprinkles); none were suggested. Incorporating simple, benefit-driven offers such as “Would you like ranch or gravy for your fries?” or “Would you like nuts or whipped cream on that sundae?” would increase average cheque and comply with Dairy Queen selling standards.
details.issues: Source tables used: Upselling Scenarios – Scenario VO-07 (Fries – dipping sauce); Upsizing Scenarios – Scenario Null-02 (specific size given, no upsize chance); Menu JSON entries – Fries (upsell: dipping sauce), Sundae (add-on: whipped cream/nuts/sprinkles), Shakes & Malts (add-on: extra malt). Ambiguities: customer requested a stand-alone “banana” which is not explicitly in the menu JSON; treated as a single banana side item with no applicable upsell/upsize. Customer-requested extra strawberry counted as part of the ordered item, not an operator-initiated topping offer.

transcript:
Operator: Yeah, any questions?
Customer: No ma'am, I'm ready to order.
Operator: Okay, go ahead.
Customer: Can I get a medium strawberry shake?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: One banana pudding.
Operator: Unfortunately, we don't have banana pudding.
Customer: Oh, I'm so sorry. One banana please.
Operator: Okay.
Customer: And can I get a large strawberry sundae with extra strawberry?
Operator: Sure thing. Can I get you anything else?
Customer: No.
Operator: Alright, go ahead and pull forward.
Customer: Can I have a regular sized fries?
Operator: Sure thing. Can I get you anything else?
Operator: It's gonna be $21.05.
Customer: Thank you.

transcript:
Operator: It's a wonderful day at Dairy Queen, how can we make it yours?
Customer: Yes, can I get the mix and match? I want the two-piece strip and fries, and then I want to order a cheese curd.
Operator: Okay, for the two-piece strip, what would your dipping sauce be?
Customer: No dipping sauce.
Operator: No dipping sauce. And then what about the dipping sauce for the cheese curd?
Customer: None.
Operator: None as well, okay. Anything else?
Customer: No, that's it.
Operator: Alright, $10.38 is the total. Would you like to round up to note in the pocket?
Customer: No.
Operator: Alright, pull forward.

details.feedback: The operator efficiently recorded the two treat items but missed every suggestive-selling opportunity. No specific upsell wording (e.g., pairing items for the 2-for-$5 promo) or topping add-on suggestions were given; the generic “What else can I get for you?” does not qualify. A valid upsizing pitch for the Blizzard (Scenario VO-06) and an add-on of extra peanuts or candy pieces for both desserts would have aligned with policy and likely increased check average. Strength: quick service and order confirmation. Improvement: use the scripted offers for large size beverages/desserts and extra toppings whenever applicable.

Upselling scenarios not applicable because treats carry none. Upsizing scenarios VO-06 applicable to Blizzard but not used. Ambiguity: Peanut Buster Parfait not explicitly listed in menu JSON; classified under Cupfection to match treat category and add-on rules.
items_addonable: Extra primary topping for Peanut Buster Parfait; Extra primary topping for Small Confetti Cake Blizzard
items_after: Peanut Buster Parfait, Small Confetti Cake Blizzard
items_initial: Peanut Buster Parfait, Small Confetti Cake Blizzard
transcript:
Operator: Hi, can I get for you?
Customer: Can I get a peanut buster parfait?
Operator: Sure thing.
Customer: And I'm gonna have one small confetti cake blizzard.
Operator: Okay. What else can I get for you?
Customer: Huh?
Operator: Can I get you anything else?
Customer: That's it.
Operator: All right, it's gonna be $12.21. You want to round up to even $13 for note in the pocket?
Customer: No.
Operator: Okay, pull forward.
Customer: Thank you.
Operator: You're welcome.

details.feedback: The operator took the order accurately but did not attempt any suggestive selling. Both items already had specified sizes, so there were no upsizing chances, but each item offered a valid additional-topping opportunity (double-dip for the cone, extra mix-ins for the Blizzard). The employee failed to mention these, resulting in missed incremental sales. Remember to offer appropriate add-ons for desserts and to ask about upgrading to a larger size whenever the customer has not already chosen one.
details.issues: Menu reference: Dipped Cone and Blizzard entries in the Menu Items JSON for add-on and upsizing possibilities. Upsizing scenarios VO-06 and VO-09 confirm size-unspecified condition; since sizes were specified, upsize chances=0. Additional topping guidance from instructions confirms 1 chance per item. No conflicting instructions encountered.
details.items_addonable: Double Dip on Dipped Cone, Extra Toppings on Blizzard

transcript:
Operator: It's a wonderful day at Dairy Queen. How can we make it yours?
Customer: Hi, can I get a small chocolate dipped chocolate ice cream cone?
Operator: Small chocolate dipped in chocolate?
Customer: Yep, and um, sorry, can I get a small caramel coffee cookie blizzard?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: That's it.
Operator: Your total is going to be $8.42. Would you like to round up to note in a pocket?
Customer: Uh, sure.
Operator: Thank you.
